text:
Test environment:
* JDK 1.4
* Slide WebDAV Library 2.1b1
  running in a repository on a
* Apache HTTP Server 2.0.48 (Linux) with mod_dav enabled
* followRedirects is enabled

Workflow:
A WebDAV resource is created for the URL "/dav/sandbox/äöü". Slide does 
transforms this into an URL "/dav/sandbox/%C3%A4%C3%B6%C3%BC" which is 
correct. The resource "äöü" is a collection, so the Apache HTTP server sends a 
redirect response back to follow to the URL "/dav/sandbox/%c3a4%c3%b6%c3%bc/" 
(notice the lowercase hex-values and the leading slash). The redirect is being 
followed and the Apache HTTP server sends a correct XML response containing 
the properties of the collection.

The Bug:
In the method setWebdavProperties() of WebdavResource.java, the XML response 
is being converted into Java objects. A response to a PROPFIND method usually 
contains information on several resources. The URL which comes with the XML 
response and the URL which was requested are compared for equality to detect 
the entry of the resource which belongs to the current WebdavResource object 
(line 1018). This equality check simply compares the String representation of 
both URL by using the equals() method. It does not recognise that the 
hexadecimal values (encoded UTF-8 characters) could be lower- or uppercase. 
The current WebdavResource is marked as being non-existent!
